title.narrative: CADS - Building Resilience through improving Absorptive & Adaptive Capacity for Transformation

description.narrative: This project aims to contribute to increased resilience of at risk households and communities, in order to improve the viability of livelihoods and enhance wellbeing. The project will have three main components (1) Improve capacity to anticipate, prepare and respond to shocks and stresses in order to maintain productive capacity; (2) Develop diversified, viable livelihood options adapted to climatic and socio-economic shocks and stresses; and (3) Strengthen community voice and ability to engage service providers and enhance their participation in decision making. Learning and knowledge exchange will be a core element in this research. With Resilience built and strengthened, the project will thus improve their livelihoods and well being despite exposure to climatic and non-climatic shocks and stresses.

This project is designed to improve the absorptive, adaptive and transformative resilience capacities for 15,505 households (62,021 individuals) in Mutoko and Mudzi districts, both extremely vulnerable to drought and exhibiting high poverty levels. Communities that lack resilience to shocks and stresses represent leaky systems - systems where human, social, environmental and economic capital is lost or wasted. This project has been designed to plug the leaks in these systems, harnessing local and external resources to strengthen their functionality, productivity, and health. The project will work in a consortium of five agencies namely BIZ, CADS, SH, NCT & CA, all with long term presence and experience in the target districts.
